column4: I broke my ubuntu installation by accidentally using a debian repo.  Is  there any way to install a complete set of apt-get packages without using apt-get, and then rebuild the system from there?  This is a network install, though I do have command line access via console to the VPS.
Or, could I list all packages which were installed/upgraded via the debian repo, and then remove them to restart?
Don't know about listing the ones from the debian repo (you could see if aptitude still works?" but you can remove them with dpkg directly...
erUSUL:  I don't see a switch for listing repo in the dpkg man page, can either of you elaborate?
